titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Middle States Commission on Higher Education Accreditation Reports RG.15.28
titlestmt.author: Nicole Greenhouse

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-09-26 15:24:37 UTC.

did.unittitle: Middle States Commission on Higher Education Accreditation Reports
did.abstract: The Middle States Commission on Higher Education Accreditation (MSCHE) Reports contains the websites related to New York University's self-study required to reaffirm its accreditation with MSCHE. Every eight years, the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE) requires New York University to reaffirm its accreditation through a self-study. The most recent self-study occurred in 2024.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by the date the website was added to the web archives.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Middle States Commission on Higher Education Accreditation Reports; RG 15.28; Wayback URL; New York University Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Archived websites were selected by Janet Bunde and captured through the use of the Internet Archive's Archive-It service. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. The accession number associated with these websites is 2025.038.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes JavaScript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Google Drive archived websites do not playback fully.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Every eight years, the Middle States Commission on Higher Education (MSCHE) requires New York University to reaffirm its accreditation through a self-study. Self-studies date back to 2004. The 2023-2024 self-study preparations began in 2021 and accreditation was received in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Middle States Commission on Higher Education Accreditation (MSCHE) Reports (July-August 2025) contains the websites related to New York University's self-study required to reaffirm its accreditation with MSCHE in 2024. The websites cover previous studies dating back to 2004; a timeline of the accreditation activities; community engagement communications; and steering committee team members. The websites also include PDFs of the narrative report, executive summary, self-study design, and MSCHE's final report.

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2025, websites were selected for capture by the University Archivist. Google Drive PDFs were added separately to the web archives using both Archive-It and Webrecorder in an attempt to better capture the content. A DACS compliant finding aid was created and the archived websites were described in ArchivesSpace.
